title: Universal Design for Learning and Differentiated Instruction Strategies for Inclusive English Education

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and basic proficiency in digital device usage
context.additional_context: Necessity of establishing an inclusive English learning environment considering diverse learner types, including visually impaired learners

learning_goals: Learners can accurately utilize math term-based English expressions at over 80% proficiency following Universal Design for Learning (UDL) principles.
Learners can create three or more English instructional materials tailored to peer learners' styles using Differentiated Instruction (DI) strategies.
Learners can design inclusive English learning environments from the perspective of visually impaired learners via VR simulation and evaluate accessibility at over 90%.

resources: Accessible Digital Resources for Visual Impairments

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
